page.title: 10TYPICAL FARM (1).
page.content: Manor Farm has been farmed by the Day family since 1897. Today it is run by father and two sons, employing one part-timer and casual labour as needed It is a cereal, beef and sheep farm totalling 194.6 hectares. The cereals grown in 1984/5 were wheat, winter and spring barley, oats, field beans and feed peas totalling 131.8 hectares. There are 56.6 hectares of grassland and 2.5 hectares of woodland. There are a maximum of 100 beef cattle feeding on home grown rolled barley and oats and ammonia treated straw. Some hay is made for the calves and for finishing off the fat cattle. In 1985, 270 ewes and 50 ewe lambs produced 520 lambs. The sheep and cattle are wintered indoors and the sheep go out with their lambs in the Spring. The farm owns 4 tractors a combine harvester and other machinery.
